On 2008-06-16, at 06:05 , Simon Chappell wrote:

> On Sat, Jun 14, 2008 at 8:32 PM, Mark Levison <mlevison@...>  
> wrote:
>
> >> ...or you could write smaller, more focused tests and learn  
> something
> >> about design.
> >
> > Is this a fair statement to make? You've never met Phil nor have you
> > seen any of his test cases. You've no idea if he writes small  
> focused
> > tests or not.
> >
> > I think we can all learn to do a better job but I don't think this
> > sort of reply serves either Phil or you well. Perhaps if this
> > discussion were face to face that would have helped us all.
>
> Having been on both sides of the debating table with JB, both agreeing
> with and disagreeing with, I would just like to say that JB has always
> been one to conduct himself with the highest level of manners and
> integrity, both on this list and in other venues.
>
Thank you, Simon. I would love your statement to hold strictly, but  
try as I might, we all know I've acted like an asshole here from time  
to time, and not just a little. Still, I appreciate your defence and  
would never turn it down.
